GEO. W. NORRELL
DRUGGIST
BRYAN, TEXAS

College Station Texas_ Aug /84
The following is my report
of the work done by me
during vacation for the College
and expenses incurred:
On the 7^th^ of July, about ten days
after the close of the Session, I visited
Galveston and remained two days.
I saw and interested as many of the
old students as possible – visiting
the principal newspapers, and
had long conversations with the
editors whom I knew personally,
attended the Normal School
of teachers then in Session – both
days and delivered an address,
representing the College – made
a point of becoming acquai[nted]
with the teachers attend[ing] [f?]
different portions of the count[ry]

represent the condition, prospects,
and work of the College. I was
gratified to find my efforts
~~noticed in~~ The Normal School
and with the editors noticed in
Complementary terms by the papers.
From Galveston I went up the
Great Northern R.R. to Huntsville
when another Normal School of
Texas was in Session. During
